column4: if sda2 is an extended should you have an sda5 or something like that?
yeah, i have a sda5 - its a swap though
tanstaffl:  so where is your linux partition?
good question. it doesn't seem to be there at all
tanstaffl:  did you boot into a livecd and check with fdisk?
yeah, im running the live cd now
what do you seen when you type: sudo fdisk -l
i'll send it over, one sec
http://pastebin.com/Kh7kbrXH
there's fdisk
tanstaafle:  looks like it was deleted.  Sorry, but it looks like you will have to re-install
i dunno what's up with it. it's rather odd
tanstaffl: if sure is, but I can assure you there is no linux partition in there
that's what my conclusion was also. except i know there was
how could the entire partion just go away?
if it was deleted, im guessing
heh, yeah that would do it. but how? could the starting cylindar have failed or something on that partion and just taken the whole thing with it?
the partion was never manually deleted
something either failed and it whiped itself, or ubuntu screwdup somewhere and reformated it
I really don't have any idea, seems really odd.
just pulled up disk utilty on the live cd, and it does say there are a few bad sectors from the SMART data
